metadata.title: CVE-2015-3185 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The ap_some_auth_required function in server/request.c in the Apache HTTPServer 2.4.x before 2.4.14 does not consider that a Require directive maybe associated with an authorization setting rather than an authenticationsetting, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended accessrestrictions in opportunistic circumstances by leveraging the presence of amodule that relies on the 2.2 API behavior.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
libapache2-mod-macro - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5').
apache2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5').
